title: Potentially life saving definitely life changing
text:
I‚Äôm still young-ish and always had very excellent blood pressure so was surprised when my cardiologist and then GP agreed that my blood pressure was way too high.  They wanted me to get a device and measure my BP.  I didn‚Äôt know how really and didn‚Äôt want something that would take long to complete.  I found this device and app and really love it.  It‚Äôs very quick to use so it does not take time (I‚Äôm more likely to take my BP more often) and the recording / tracking is the best part bc it automatically records then shows me not only the results but how good or bad they are with a quick graph.  And the accumulated data is, of course, great to see over time.   
It‚Äôs very easy and most importantly quick to use.  So, I desire to use it and am more closely following and rectifying my BP.   I don‚Äôt want medication so I‚Äôm doing this, instead.

title: Broken and corrupting data
text:
I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs the iOS 13 update or what, but I‚Äôm ready to throw this thing in the trash. First of all, throughout the last 18 months of owning Qardiobase 2, it has been nominally reliable, with spats of problems. All of a sudden, the scale will be off by 10+ lbs, consistently the same amount, and then a reboot of the scale will fix it. This is annoying and undermines trust of the product and brand, but I‚Äôve dealt with it by going into the app and deleting those data points. Today, it started giving me wild results, but when I went into the app to delete the data, that no longer works. So I tap delete, but the data point remains. I had to go into Health app to delete multiple data types, and still the scale is registering me as a different member of the household, with no way to correct it. I do not feel this product is stable enough to be used as a tool for health and fitness. I regret the purchase and I‚Äôm ready to move on.

Update: I have done a system reset of the scale and it appears to be working again. I‚Äôm still frustrated, but at least my problem has been resolved for the time being. I feel the app does many extraneous things that I don‚Äôt use, and would prefer the development team spend their time focusing on stability of the core features like weighing and storing the results. The UX of the app is pretty wonky, it does not feel at all like a native app.

title: App Routinely Crashes
text: I‚Äôve been a regular user of QardioArm A100 blood pressure monitor for about 1 year.  The first 9 months or so months it seemed like the ideal monitor.  I even bragged about it to my medical provider.  I had the setting set up for 3 consecutive measurements with the photo display running during the measurement process.  Shortly after switching to a new iPhoneX the app began routinely crashed midway during the process.  Frequently during the first 1 of 3 measurements.  I then changed my setting from 3 to 1 reading and also turned off the photo feature.  It helped but did correct the problem.  The app still frequently crashes and closes.  I am working hard to manage my BP and now am having to rely on a single measurement, this is a concern, especially because the QuardioArm‚Äôs instructions clearly state that a user needs multiple measurements for a more accurate reading.  Additionally, I have corresponded with their customer service through email, they were responsive, acknowledging my concerns but in the end offered no solution.  As time passes I keep hoping I‚Äôll see an app update in the iTunes Store but thus far I have seen nothing.  In fact I find no history that they ever do any corrective updates.  It‚Äôs disappointing that what had started out as an excellent price/value tool and resource is now no more than just another outdated technology purchase flopping around in my junk drawer like my old flip phone.

title: Qardio BP Cuff - doesn‚Äôt inflate and no tech support
text:
My physician asked me to take my BP every day so I purchased this based on reviews and it‚Äôs app for the I-Phone.

It worked great for the first couple of months and then started throwing Z-codes.  They aren‚Äôt listed in the manual.  When tech support eventually replied to the email query, they simply stated I needed to adjust the cuff.  Tried that and it continued to intermittently throw Z codes.  The symptom is that the cuff won‚Äôt inflate.  Changed batteries several times in case that was it, and no improvement.  It no longer inflates at all.  Still no response.  I wanted it traded under warranty as it‚Äôs still under warranty.  No luck.  I question the actual size of this company given lack of response re email and the fact that the phone is never answered.  Would not recommend purchasing this.  They either won‚Äôt, or can‚Äôt support their product nor warranty.

UPDATE:  I got a response from them (!).  Have sent information requested for a replacement and will see if they come through.  It will be great if the replacement works as well long term as the one I have.  The upload feature was great, and the unit is much smaller than my old large unit I had to go back to.

title: Please Fix Your App! I‚Äôm BEGGING!
text: This has been going on for maybe over a year - the app is aggressively slow and unstable Want to know what you weighed a year ago? Don‚Äôt try scrolling through your weight graph because it is EXTREMELY slow, choppy, AND even over compensates for your movement. You‚Äôll end up scrolling to two years ago with a single swipe and have no way to stop it. Incredibly frustrating. If you‚Äôre lucky, the app won‚Äôt crash on you. title: Frustrated with the app
text:
Connected to the QardioBase2 easily but I've not been able to get it to recognize myself or provide other measurements. The only instructions provided are to download the app. The app walks through the setup process. All seems easy until you start weighing yourself and you can't get it to recognize that it's YOU and not a guest. I used the "Claim" function to assign weights to me but the next weigh in still goes to a guest with no choice of another user available. If there is something else I need to do in the setup, it is not obvious.

Update: I went through the setup process a second time and noticed that some of the steps seemed to get skipped passed and again had the scale only record as guest. Went through the setup a third time and each step waited for confirmation button presses and connected properly showing my name as an available choice to select from on the scale. Not sure why the first two setup attempts would skip through some of the steps but I would suggest to try repeatedly until success.

title: QardioArm doesn‚Äôt seem reliable
text:
I‚Äôve had my QardioArm for about six months. Like others, I wanted something that stored my data for me - no muss, no fuss. For the most part, the app operates well. I do wish there was an obvious way to download and share data with my doctor (who does not provide me with an email address, which is the current way to share it). My real issue is with the QardioArm.

In regards to the QardioArm, I question the accuracy of its measurements. I have watched all the how-to videos and use as directed. However, I can get five wildly different readings sitting in the same position. It doesn‚Äôt seem to be able to correctly read my pulse, and frequently (4 out of 5 times) gives me an ‚Äúirregular heartbeat‚Äù warning. This caused enough of a scare to share the data with my cardiologist. After wearing a Holter monitor for a week, there were no signs of irregular heartbeat. 

I am now doing side-by-side comparisons of the QardioArm with my regular blood pressure monitor. The regular is providing more consistent readings.

title: Difficult to activate
text:
In order for the device to register green or activate, I have to open the battery cover every time else it doesn't register. Frustrating process that in itself raises my blood pressure.  Is there a problem with my device?

I've changed my rating because the agent that responded to me needs some training in how to speak to his customers. He said "I am the issue" rather an interesting way of conveying a message to those who purchase your products. Bad company.

The unit was replaced with a new one the device worked perfectly for a week then it started loosing Bluetooth connectivity again only this time I have to forget the device and pair it again. When it works it is great but when it doesn't well it elevates my blood pressure. I changed the rating again because of the effort rendered by customer service after I expressed my disappointment with their initial response. The product on the other hand doesn't always work as it is supposed to.

title: LOVE QUARDIO BPM
text:
I've had mine over 2 years and many other types of BP monitors since I developed heart issues 29 years ago. It's small enough to take on walks. This is the best by far! The reliability is most important of all. Recording data is next. Then the fabulous support when I report a problem. As soon as I report a problem support is there. Then they send me a new replacement as soon as they determine a fault that needs same. I bought my wife one a few months back when cardiologist wanted daily records. She loves it too!! We recommended it to our five adult children ages 50-29 and all our friends.

09july2017 It's about 3 years now. I still love this BP unit and their support.

06may2019 It‚Äôs almost 5 years now. My wife and I still love this BP unit and especially their EXCELLENT SUPPORT which does not waiver no matter how long ago we bought our units!

title: Arm sleeve and app raises bp
text: I wanted to love the Qardio arm...but it doesn‚Äôt want to turn on upon unwrapping it, or pulling in the tag (which I‚Äôm convinced is nothing). Following the directions given, wrapping it tightly around the unit, etc., does nothing. We have to roll, unroll, roll, unroll multiple times and it still takes forever to get it to turn on. title: If your priority is Health...
text: I‚Äôve used Qardio with the QardioArm and QardioBase products for about 6 months.  Recent updates have improved stability, although I needed to do a delete and fresh install to make sure I had the latest version.  The app tracks weight, body metrics, and BP in separate categories and makes it easy to see changes over time.  It‚Äôs better than the combined diary/timeline approach for me, as I can easily check and report my latest measurements without hunting for the data.  Qardio doesn‚Äôt push social aspects like some others do, which I appreciate. Goal setting is straightforward.  Overall, it‚Äôs helpful to have one app that works with more than one product.

title: Needs a lot of work
text: Right now the app in its state needs a lot of work. The app freezes at least once in every session and I‚Äôm not using it for more than a minute or two. That‚Äôs the biggest issue but then the app itself is missing a few items like body fat percentage is only shown at the whole number level. Many other scales show it at the first decimal. There also are no charts other than a list for visualization. You can add friends but only to see blood pressure not weight. I weigh myself early in the morning and when Apple Health syncs an hour later at 6:30 every morning it shows that I weigh 0lbs. Luckily this doesn‚Äôt affect Apple Health but the issue is when I set a goal each day it says I achieved my goal because I‚Äôm at 0 lbs. it would also be nice to see the lbs of the percentages rather than just whole number percentage. If your option is to buy this scale at $150 don‚Äôt...there are better options out there. I got the scale for $80 and I‚Äôm still questioning the purchase but hopefully they can work on it and get it closer to Withings or Fitbit.

title: Mostly good, sometimes screwy with the hardware
text:
The app itself does that it needs to do, record blood pressure and show it over to as well, and sync to Apple health.

That said the QuardioArm perhaps is a bit to slick for its own good. It small and folds up but seems to have issues sometimes waking up. A power button with auto shut off would would have been better than screwing with the cuff until the phone ‚Äúsees‚Äù it. This can be maddening as it can take folding up and strapping it on about 2-3 times when it‚Äôs feeling sleepy.

Second, and more serious is you can get really crazy readings when the batteries are low. I felt off and it spooked the hell out of me until I used my mom‚Äôs semi-school blood pressure unit. Then I swapped the batteries and found it was pretty close to the other unit. I‚Äôd prefer a rechargeable model with precise battery readings.

title: Too many issues
text:
Qardio App:
Since day one I‚Äôve noticed the app keeps on crashing and certain features like the graph causes the app to close when selected. All the features on the Application seem very basic with nothing that really stands out.  I haven‚Äôt noticed any significant updates (or any to be honest) since I purchased the Qardio Base 2 in Nov 2019 and slowly it seems like the application is deteriorating.  

Qardio Base 2: I honestly expected more and I feel like I purchased an overpriced scale. There was a time that the scale was off by 10 lbs and ever since then i‚Äôm not too confident with the readings. If I drink water or use the restroom and I compare the before and after readings my weight on the scale is exactly the same but on a $20 scale I bought at Costco it shows my weight has changed. I emailed customer support and they told me to calibrate the scale by stepping on it and allowing it to reset but I feel like I constantly have to keep doing that.

title: App has constantly crashed. For years.
text:
I have both the Qardiobase 2 and qardioarm, and have had both for about 2 years now. Software seems to be the big issue here. The app constantly crashes when trying to take blood pressure readings, as man others have said. I have the latest version installed, I‚Äôve reinstalled in the past, it‚Äôs just clearly a poorly coded app. How many apps crash and freeze multiple times a day in 2019, on multiple screens, seemingly at random and within 2-3 minutes of opening the app? It‚Äôs a really sad situation, and I don‚Äôt recommend this device to anyone anymore. I check my BP 3 times a week, and probably average ~5 app freezes or crashes a week. The act of reading your blood pressure shouldn‚Äôt raise your blood pressure. :)
I hope they scrap this codebase and start over with another app, this one isn‚Äôt working.

I‚Äôll give 2 stars because the hardware is nice, and when the app works, it‚Äôs fine, and I appreciate the Apple health sync (when it works).

title: Minor adjustments needed
text:
I have the Qardio app to use with the Base 2 scale. I'm considering returning the scale because it does not seem accurate:

1) The scale displays one weight and the app sync shows another. It's usually 0.1 pounds different but that should not be the case.

2) When I started with the Qardio Base2, I was dehydrated as I rarely drink any beverages. For a week now I've been hydrating well but my water composition percentage remains the same (49-50%). I'm not sure if this is more reflective of the app or the scale. 

3) When I step on the Qardio Base2 scale, three times immediately back-to-back, I get 3 different readings for weight.

4) The app shows a history tracker chart for weight, BMI, and body fat %.  Because the scale and app both show figures for water and bone composition, it would be nice to view those charts as well. There currently is no option for that. Suggestion: allow a toggle that can show two or more charts together for comparison.

I like the app's potential but more is needed. Part of the problem could be with the scale so I'm hoping the app might have an update for me to try before I decide to return the Base2 scale. Otherwise, the scale gives me a good estimate of my weight (not sure about the accuracy of the other readings) and the app is workable with good functionality.

title: Used to be great!
text: I have both the QardioArm and QardioBase. They both worked flawlessly for both my husband and I who have iPhone 7‚Äôs and had I rated it a year ago, would have been 5 stars. It‚Äôs very important that I take my BP everyday as recommended by my cardiologist. A few months ago the app started constantly crashing and I cannot get my readings. title: App is a disaster
text:

title: Crashes often
text:

From the start, the app would crash once in a while, but since the last update the app crashes everyone I try to take my blood pressure ‚Äî noting that i use the three measurement recording. title: Excellent product - Qardio Arm
text: I've used Qardio arm for over a year. I managed to break the first one iPhone after about four months. I got a full replacement at no charge! I use the product every day. I have no problem with batteries. A set of batteries last about two months. Maybe more. I love the reports that I get and love that I have over one year of data stored on my iPhone. I am on no medication and I am trying to avoid that. My blood pressure was at the point where I might need medication. Through exercise and good nutrition it has come back to the normal range. This device helps me a lot! If you want to monitor your blood pressure I can highly recommend this product.

title: Good app but huge storage hog
text: In general, I'm looking this app. It's sleek and functions well. There's just one issue that forces me to knock down the review from 4 or 5 stars. I've only owned the app a few months, and already it's ballooned to take up 5 GB of storage on my iPhone, with no obvious way to get rid of whatever it's storing that's ballooned the size of the app and associated docs to such an enormous size other than deleting and reinstalling the app. (I haven't done this yet, as I have 256 GB of storage.) I don't know what this app is storing that's taking up so much space. Surely a few weights and blood pressure readings a week can't be doing it, as that shouldn't take up 5 GB of storage. More annoying, every time there's an update to the app, it wants to rebuild the database, which now takes a long time.

title: App is awful
text:
This app when working is great. I have had nothing but problems with logging in and getting my data to show up. I am running ios13.1.1 on a iPhone 11 pro and things don't seem compatible.

title: Great health tool, small bugs in app
text:
Highly recommend! 

My cardiologist suggested I start monitoring my blood pressure so I got the Qardio Arm. Love it! Really happy I can so easily monitor my blood pressure to make sure I am staying healthy. Easy to use 99% of the time. 

Every now and then it aborts mid measure and sometimes doesn't want to pair with my wife's phone. We have always been able to use it so the issues are an inconvenience not a show stopper. title: Latest app version update is total garbage
text: App Store pushed app version upgrade a day ago. On launching app on iPhone 7 with iOS 12.1, all I got was a green screen. Would not proceed to authentication.  Submitted bug ticket to Qardio. Several hours later I upgraded phone to iOS 12.1.1 which appeared to clear up solid green screen. But now the app crashes while taking blood pressure measurements. Obviously, very frustrating to have an app that worked so reliably for so long now be totally useless. It just crashes and goes away with no message of what went wrong. Software quality control must be asleep at Qardio ‚Äî or they should get someone who knows how to run a team that quality assures new releases to catch/correct bugs before the new app version is released.

text:

title: Great Products and App if it didn‚Äôt constantly crash
text:
I‚Äôve been using the Qardio Base and Blood Pressure for almost 6 months. Solid readings for base and very similar to other products from Nokia (Withings) and Fitbit. Nothing stands out a big differentiator on the Qardio Base. Nokia has an air reading which who really cares or uses that(?!).

title: Data privacy is deal breaker
text:
This looks like a great app, which when paired with the devices would give powerful analytics about your health and lifestyle trends. Unfortunately the app requires creation of an online account and sending the collected health information to their cloud. For me it‚Äôs simply too much info to put into yet another company‚Äôs cloud: date of birth, height, weight, blood pressure, heart rate, etc.  Bear in mind your social insurance number, address, email, are already out there on the internet from other systems that have been hacked.  No matter how secure, companies get hacked, and/or they get acquired. 

Qardio could offer an option to store my health data locally, or in iCloud, but they didn‚Äôt.  It‚Äôs true that they can deliver a better experience by collecting all of this data. It‚Äôs also substantially better for their business model. For me it‚Äôs a deal breaker.

title: Works great
text: I‚Äôd give it a five star rating except it tries to be cute about turning on and connecting with Bluetooth without in physical switches. I‚Äôve always gotten to work but sometimes it takes a little fiddling to get it wakeup and connect.  There‚Äôs no indicator light that‚Äôs on either. title: Cuff great. APP is aggravating Freezes
text: The cuff is great except I can‚Äôt get it roll up easily when finished. The APP is not old people friendly. Light grey , small font used. Very difficult to read. text: I‚Äôve barely owned my Qardio Arm for 2 months and it will not power on. The device doesn‚Äôt have anyway to charge it and it‚Äôs supposed to power on when you unravel it. title: Lots of bugs in app
text: Just bought a QardioBase 2 and so far I am having a lot of trouble using it with 2 users. title: Not reliable and unsafe
text:
Apologizes if this review appears twice. We attempted to submit this review previously.

Our institution purchased several QARDIOARM and QARDIOBASE devices to evaluate the potential for large scale remote monitoring.

Although we found the accuracy of these devices to be excellent, the reliability of this app was dismal.

Several participants reported that they could not log into the app. We were told the app would not accept their passwords, and even after changing their passwords they could not log into the app or Qardio web site. Several that chose to use TouchID or FaceID on their devices kept receiving error messages saying ‚Äúbad credentials.‚Äù We were told that several also tried to contact Qardio and then received emails appearing to be from Qardio but originating from unrelated addresses.

The inability of individuals to log into this app and have their critical information recorded and sent to us, such as blood pressure measurements in high risk individuals, presents an unsafe situation.

At this time, we cannot support use of this app or any devices associated with it, until Qardio corrects the unreliable password credential process used to try to login into this app.

Thanks.

You will appreciate the fact that you can contact the makers of this app through the app to make suggestions or report problems. Qardio, best app ever!
